creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: male figure in workshop delicately tapping a sculpture with a mallet; sculpture features a standing woman cradling an infant on her PR, and embracing a standing nude toddler at her PL
inscription: in graphite on verso: B.123 I | H.285 | sl- | 557 | 119 | 7/6 | 7C2
medium: Etching and drypoint on gampi paper
provenance: Tristram Carlyon, Esq. (1877-1957); his Rembrandt sale, P. & G. Colnaghi & Co., London (possibly in late 1950s), stock no. R557; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: The Goldsmith
